WorkItem.ClosedComment:
No body voted for IE6 and it is very low in priority of support.
Its impact is very low
WorkItem.Description:
In IE6 the categories do not display.  Also the "top leaders", "Top Movers" and "Popular Tags" sections are empty.

IE6 sp3
WorkItem.Summary: Site does not render properly in IE6

Comments.Message:
Do you really care of supporting IE6 ?! I am not sure if the team will vote for IE6 support.
Myself I vote for not supporting IE6
I forgot to mention that you can build you own views and styles that can support IE6 if you wish.

Personally I don't care if it supports IE6.  I don't use it myself, however many people do and I happened to try my site at work where they only have IE6.  I think a robust site should support IE6, or at least have some kind of degradation.  Even if the links just show as a simple list or something.  For the tags not to show at all is not too good.  I guess I can try to create some of my own views and fix it, but I would think it would be a common request.

Yes, samething I see many people comment about! But for me it is a point of view! we are on 2009! and on 2010 MS will supporting it.
End users must also care about poor people like us -Developer- :o) they must know the pain we had when trying to work on IE6
